review.reviewBody: The best boot for when you do a lot of hiking and need to be nimble.  Unfortunately, the fabric lace eyelets rip out.  Professionals will shred these in a year or two of service.  I like them enough that I just plan on buying new ones every year or so.
review.name: Great boot, moderate durability.

review.reviewBody:
I spend more time on foot than in the boat so I was after a boot that would be durable and sturdy across land as much as in the water. The M's Flyweight are performing well in this regard. The sole is remarkably "sticky" so far and inspires a lot of confidence in stability. I can't imagine what they'd be like with cleats! 

They are a boot so they do have a bit of heft to them, but relative to other boots I have used these are pretty light.
review.name: Sturdy Boot with Great Traction

review.reviewBody: For 2 seasons I really loved these boots.  Lightweight, great grip w/studs  & great for hiking - most places I fish require a good 2 mi+ hike (~ 50 days/yr).  But then they started falling apart, eyelets broke, soles are very worn down, had to glue the sole back on in spots, etc.  The durability on these boots are not that great at all for the price.
review.name: Poor durability

review.reviewBody: My daily driver especially for longer hike in tailwater fishing. I've gotten a LOT of use out of my first pair and am getting ready to re-order. Would benefit from a slightly more durable lace and eyelet combination. That's what I wore out first. Good general grip. I wet wade in these w/ just rock guards and winter fish in them as well. Bought 1 size above my standard shoe size for use with Simms 4 mil neoprene guide pant.
review.name: Hike in, hike out!

review.reviewBody: Awesome Boots…Very light weight and great comfort!!
The wading boot is light, yet durable. Very comfortable.  My favorite wading boot hands down.  I wear them about 300 days a year.
Awesome wading boot.  Super light.  Easier to hike, wade and less bulky.  Great boot!!
review.name: Awesome Boot!!

review.reviewBody: Well made and appear as advertised. Listen to the people at Simms and size up! I wear a 10.5-11 in street shoes and hiking boots, and the size 12 Flyweights fit right with heavy socks and a neoprene-footer wader. We’ll see how durable the fabric lace loops hold up- I’ll tie an overhand knot before proceeding to the ankle lace hooks.  The metal loops for the gravel guard hooks are pretty far forward, so takes a bit of stretching to clip them on.  Anxious to try these without studs before deciding if adding metal is necessary.
review.name: Nice lightweight rubber-soled boot

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight.  Great for all day use “running and gunning” fishing.
review.name: Very satisfied

review.reviewBody: One of the best wading boots that I have worn in 40 years. Very comfortable and lightweight. Fantastic.
review.name: They are easy to put on and fit very well and comfortable fishing and wading  all day long.

name: Flyweight Wading Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great-fitting, mid-weight, jacket-hoodie. Material is soft and comfortable and fit can easily fit under a puffer for added warmth.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: It doesn't help when you said the model is 3ft 11in and 47 lbs Age 6,
review.name: Is the model a Dwarf?

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this jacket! Very comfortable, no shoulder seams. Id like to request one change. Please start embroidering the name and logo again! The "newer" way of screen printing the logo on items seams to make the items cheaper in appearance and not worthy of the brand...
review.name: My new goto jacket

review.reviewBody: Love the clean lines and no seams on the shoulders. Cuts the cold and wind.
review.name: Good to cut cold and wind

review.reviewBody: I love how this product feels. It is more warm than I thought it would be when at rest. It breathes better than I thought a coat could when in motion.
review.name: New favorite coat

review.reviewBody: I use this as a layer to go under my jacket for additional warmth. The hoodie feels warm and soft to the touch. There are 2 pockets on the outside which are nice to have. This jacket does not come with an inside pocket which is disappointing. The jacket feels a little snug to me compared to any other north face jacket or fleece.
review.name: I would recommend this hoodie to anyone.

review.reviewBody: This jacket is light weight but soft and flexible for an active guy. It's absolutely perfect for a brisk fall day.
review.name: Stylish and cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We returned for size, bought a Large. Fabric seems really nice.
review.name: We bought the wrong size.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the layer I didn't know I was missing. Bought it for backcountry skiing but now use it for everything.
review.name: Use it for everything

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like the product. Warm and comfortable. Feels like it'll work as a mid layer
review.name: Nice and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing classic high for years. These are daily wear work boots, hunting boots in all but the coldest days. Fishing boots. I love these boots. I've tried muck brand boots and they are nice also but boggs has the better fit. As long as they don't change them up I'll continue to wear this style bogg boot from now on.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Really good mud boots. Warm, dry, comfortable. I get about two years out of a pair. None better.
review.name: Good boots

review.reviewBody: The only thing I really don't like is you don't make them wider. I have really wide feet. I usually buy 11 but they hurt my feet after wearing them 4 or 5 hours in my boat or working around outside. I bought a 12 this time and they are still a little snug but not as bad.
review.name: Long lasting, and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: The top of these boots curves inward and destroys my calves. My old pair fit like a glove. Quality is poor on this pair.
review.name: My old pair fit way better

review.reviewBody: These boots are great, super comfortable and easy to slip on and off. They're warm and have good traction. A super versatile boot whether riding on a snow machine or walking with snow shoes. They are my go-to winter boot.
review.name: My go-to boot for most winter occasions...

review.reviewBody: This is the second pair of these boots I've owned, the first pair fit perfect. My second pair even tho it was the same size, number, etc. I think they fit just a little big looser then my first pair.
review.name: Long Lasting

review.reviewBody: Good fit. Comfortable, warm and dry. Excellent mud boots.
review.name: What?

review.reviewBody: These are the best snow boots I've ever wore or owned. They are comfortable and warm.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Excellent mud boots. Warm and dry and comfortable.
review.name: Good boots as stated.

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! So comfortable and waterproof! Exactly what I was looking for!
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: The tires were a great fit—- very easy to install. I could not find arrow indicators but the tread made it obvious.
review.name: Easy Install

review.reviewBody: The Armadillo is a seemingly indestructible, but note if you're sizing up, these have a taller profile. I've been running 26mm Armadillos on my SL4 Tarmac for wet training rides, and recently sized up from 25 to 28mm with S-Works Turbo T5s on my carbon rims, and loved the ride feel! So, I thought I'd do the same with these, but nope! Where the Turbos leave ~3-4mm to spare to the downtube, the Armadillos ended up tight against it. No luck. So I'm back to the 26s. (the Tarmac has a very tight 405mm chain stay, so your mileage may vary)
review.name: Tall profile sits higher on rim

review.reviewBody: These tires are shipped in their regular shape, not folded, which makes them easier to get on the rim. I've used these for cross-country bike touring, commuting and competing in triathlons with questionable road conditions. These are my go-to tires.
review.name: They ship shaped, not folded

name: All Condition Armadillo Clincher Tire

description: Buy the Coleman Onesource Heated Chair Sioc online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Onesource Heated Chair Sioc
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Onesource Heated Chair Sioc online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Chair does not get warm at all, very disappointed!
review.name: No heat!
comment:
Hello! We're also disappointed that the quality of this chair, didn’t meet your expectations. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. Your feedback is highly appreciated and valued by the business, and we will make sure that your insights are shared. 

If you have any additional queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: I hate to be critical, but I had the same experience as the other reviewers.  The chair itself is sturdy, comfortable, and well made; however, I bought this for the heated seat feature.  It  barely warms up while being set at the high temperature for 30 minutes.  I could attribute the slightly warm feeling to the few minutes I sat in it.   Perhaps this particular chair is defective, but I’ll call tomorrow in order to resolve.
review.name: Disappointed
comment:
Hi there,

Thank you for posting a review, and we appreciate you sharing your experience with our product. We understand that our OneSource™ Heated Chair & Rechargeable Battery is not warm as expected. This is not the experience that we want you to have. We appreciate your feedback. If there is anything that we can assist you please do not hesitate to contact us

Have a wonderful day.

review.reviewBody:
I was so excited about this to sit out in the cold at soccer games! Alas, I pre-tested the chair before using it outside, and it just doesn’t get very warm. I could barely feel any heat through the thin leggings I was wearing, so I doubt when I’m bundled up & outside that it will have any warming effect whatsoever. 

The chair is also very “relaxed” in that it slouches back at an angle, which puts pressure on your glutes- I am 5’8 and could not get comfortable, I imagine those on the shorter side would struggle to get their feet to touch the ground.  

I love the concept of it blocking the wind with no openings on the sides, but that is pretty much the only feature I like. Even the cup holder seems small, my yeti won’t fit in it.

Back to the store it goes.
review.name: Not as warm as it states!!
comment:
Thank you for posting a review. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and we are sorry that our OneSource™ Heated Chair & Rechargeable Battery is not warm as expected. This is not the experience that we want you to have. We will make sure to take note of your feedback for review. We are always looking for ways to better our product and services, and your feedback would certainly help us in improving it moving forward.

Have a great day.

description: Buy the MSR Alpine Chef's Knife online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine Chef's Knife
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine Chef's Knife online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This knife served me well for about 3 weeks out of a 30 day canoe trip. Cut veggies perfectly, wasn't rusting at all, sheath was easy to clean. We stored it down the front packet of a pack and tragically it snapped in half one day when the front of the pack was quite round. I wish it had just bent instead but I know that would be a lot to ask of gear this light, it would be great if there was a heavy duty version. I would recommend this chef knife but I would also recommend transporting it against something flat and rigid so yours doesn't meet the same untimely demise.
review.name: Awesome but not indestructable

review.reviewBody: Great knife. I have two. One for camping. And one for work. The other knives from MSR a awesome too. My Kitchen Kit has the Chef knife. And pairing knife for two.
review.name: Great knife. I have two.

review.reviewBody: Being a chef, I appreciate a simple quality product. This knife is better than most “high end” brands. You can hone an extremely sharp edge easily. Good ergonomics. Easy to clean and care for. The sheath is fantastic. The price is right.
review.name: Buy this knife

review.reviewBody: Not a major issue, but the knife developed rust spots where it touched the sheath, likely due to some trapped moisture. Happened after first week long trip. Other than that, nice, lightweight and sharp. beats using a pocket knife to cut veggies.
review.name: Good knife, but rust after first week

review.reviewBody: Sharp knife and love the included sheath for ease of packing and safety.
review.name: I would recommend to others

review.reviewBody: Brought this along on a cross country camping trip and it was great - super sharp and super useful!
review.name: Great, functional cooking knife

review.reviewBody: We are SUV campers and serious wildland travelers. Before getting this knife, we had to carefully pack my wife's pricey and huge chef's knife. This is much easier to pack, is well suited to downsized camp cooking, and the plastic sheath protects both the quality blade and our fingers and hands, as we rummage through our gear box.
review.name: Sharp, light and safely packable

review.reviewBody: Why to take a cooking knife if you got a swiss knife with you? Because this one will be used exclusively for cooking, because it's in appropriate size and shape and because it's light and thin.
review.name: Light and practical

review.reviewBody: I bought a few knives for my car camping set- up and I've been so happy with the ease of use and fidelity of the blades. They are unbelievably sharp and have remained sharp over the numerous days of outdoor adventures.
review.name: Sharp Knives:WOW!

review.reviewBody: I went on a climbing trip with a friend and tried out his culinary knife. I could not believe how light it was yet it still handled like a legit chefs knife. I'll be purchasing my own soon as its great for anything from car camping to an overnighter in the backcountry.
review.name: Incredibly light!

name: Alpine Chef's Knife

hasVariant.description: Buy the Goodyear Connector Ultimate Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These tires really do excel in mud and are more than reasonable on pavement and hard-packed trails. I took them on a 380 mile ride though Tuscany, IT, on a lot of mountain paths and singletrack, with a decent showing of gravel trails. I cannot say I'd recommend this use case, but I did survive. I put less than 2k miles on them before the rear's center tread wore down the whole way, with those miles being half paved half not. I could have gotten them over 2k easily if I had rotated them... but...

These are the WORST mounting tires I have ever mounted. I would almost always end up at 95% mounted and ride them like that, because no amount of over-inflation, prying, lubrication, or anything else would get them up on the rims fully. I wish this wasn't the case.

I give a 4/5 because your mileage may vary with rim sizing, but I have not had nearly this problem with Conti, Maxxis, or Schwalbe.
review.name: Hardest tire to mount I have ever used

review.reviewBody: These are really good tires.  I've ridden it for over 500 miles and it gobbles up gravel without any problems.  The one con with these tires though is that it was very difficult to set the bead on my carbon rims.  It took a about an hour of fiddling using an air compressor to finally set it.
review.name: Great tires but difficult to mount

review.reviewBody:
Hadn't read any reviews of Goodyear's tires, but I liked the tread. Reminds me of DONNELLY
X'Plor MSO, which I liked but always seemed kinda klunky to me (not sure how to describe it, they just never felt fast).

These seem great so far. I run them on 25mm internal width carbon rims at about 30-35 psi (I'm 157lbs) and they seem really great on both road and gravel. Fast rolling, good traction and comfortable. Sizing seems correct but I haven't pulled out the calipers.
review.name: These seem really great so far

name: Connector Ultimate Tubeless Tire

review.reviewBody:
The Next Gen style runs considerably smaller than the original Hydro Moc.
I purchased these for both my wife and myself. I've worn out 4 or 5 pairs of the original Hydro Mocs and I much prefer this Next Gen style over the original. Even though I am almost never on pavement the original Hydro Moc style wears quickly by comparison, and around the yard I've had thorns and prickers stick in my foot because they pierce the thinner soft sole. Also, the original style is dangerously slippery on a smooth wet surface. I find the Next Gen model a huge improvement.
review.name: Next Gen big improvement over original, runs small

review.reviewBody: I love these so far! Great for traveling and active environments. Fit a bit short in length than i would prefer. Im usually 6.5 and the size 7 was snug in length (not width), but still comfortable enough for me to wear. Maybe thats the ergonomics of this shoe. Would buy again.
review.name: Yay

review.reviewBody: I bought these because I am a healthcare worker on my feet for 10 & 12 hour shifts. These are the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever worn. Hard pass.
review.name: Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a vacation about 2 weeks ago, and it recked my feet. I got the right size and everything, but the skin around my ankles was damaged and bleeding after the first day. I tried wearing a bandaid and giving the shoe another try, but it was so painful. the bottom of the feet were comfortable and I wish I could love it, but the ankle parts are just too painful. And this was the same for my husband, so it wasn't just a ME issue.
review.name: Bleeding, Painful Ankles

review.reviewBody: This didn't work for me.  My size felt like it was going to fall off and it pinched my big toe.  My husband said they didn't even look good on.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody:
I walk 3 miles every day and these are wonderful! I also use them around the house, run errands- just daily living activities!
I pretty much live in them 😅
I have the Hydro mocs in white and blue but these are so much more comfortable 😁
review.name: Fantastic!!

review.reviewBody:
I have a pair of hydro Mocs from years ago that I still wear! They’re so “jellie” and supportive in the arch.
I recently bought 2 new pair on sale. Not the same material and over sized! Not sure I’ll purchase Merrell again.
review.name: Meh!

review.reviewBody: This shoe is super comfortable and cute. Def recommend
review.name: Fashion forward and comfy

review.reviewBody: I have bad feet from standing way too long in the heart cat lab. These are so comfortable I bought 2.
comment: Thank you for sharing your positive feedback!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable but just a regular clog so definitely not worth the high price. The plastic is too hard around the heel and ankle but I’m hoping to use heat to stretch this out and make them more comfortable
review.name: Hydro moc

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: I bought this bike rack and enjoy the ease of taking the bikes on the back of the SUV with this.  It's easy to use and keeps the bike safe.
review.name: Great Bike Rack!

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: I've been using my Thule T2 Pro rack for over 6 years. The rack has no wobble at the hitch and makes for a super smooth ride even with it fully loaded on rough accesses roads. I rarely take the rack off my truck so it is exposed to daily driving and the elements over 300days a year. Highly recommend this rack.
review.name: Solid

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody:
Love my Thule T2 PRO XTR. Thule thinks of everything. Just bought kayak holders too. Have had a ski carrier for eons💕.
I just need another key for bike rack where it locks into 2" hitch...lost mine😢🫣
review.name: Awesome bike rack

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: This rack is a beast to assemble in my view. It will not raise and lower predictably and there is a scant instruction manual and no user manual at all. I am struggling to get the umbrella handle to move and this moment my bike is stuck on the rack until I figure it out. I have used several Thule racks for bikes and kayaks over the years and this rack was not a great choice for me, I am 100 percent frustrated. Once properly on, the bike is held securely.
review.name: Mixed
comment:
Thank you for alerting us to the issue you experienced with your Thule T2 Pro XTR. 
A Thule Customer Support representative has reached out to assist with the sticking handle issue you reported.

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: I've used this rack twice. When I secured my bike and went to wrap the cable, the entire assembly came out in my hand. I didn't pull on it very hard but yet, the lock, cable, and spring came out of the bar. I can see that it was secured inside the bar with just a thin piece of plastic. Convenient design perhaps, but if a slight tug can break it, I don't trust it at all. I may be regretting this purchase.
review.name: Poor security cable
comment:
Thank you for alerting us to the issue you experienced with your Thule T2 Pro XTR locking cable. This is certainly not a common occurrence and is something we will want to look closer into to determine the cause and the best resolution. 
A Thule representative has reached out for more information and to assist further. 
For damages caused by suspected material or manufacturing defects, please submit warranty claims through Thule.com:
https://www.thule.com/en-us/about-thule/warranty

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody:
I love this rack. We used to carry our bikes in an old van. I loved how easy it was to wheel them right into the back. When we had to retire the van I tried to find something that would be as easy and there just aren't many choices. We finally went with a Subaru and that dream was gone. I bought this rack in desperation and it's so, so much better than I ever thought it could be--even better than the van. It's just so thoughtfully designed! It only takes seconds to get the bikes on. They're secure and nothing is rubbing against my carbon fiber or nice paint job. The dirt stays out of the car. I could go on and on. 

There are only a couple of products in my life that are so delightful that I think about how happy they make me every time I use them--this is one. A home run for Thule.
review.name: Blow away by how great it is

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: This is a great sturdy rack but it's heavy.  It's very easy to put together and very easy to take on an off the vehicle. One con is that the cable locks don't reach the frame of my mountain bike so it only allows me to lock around the fork.
review.name: Great Rack but heavy

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: After much research I landed on this bike rack.  I've had it for a month and it's been working great, better than any other I've had.  It's easy to get bikes in and out of it, I really like being able to tilt it down to allow access to the tailgate with bikes on it.  Being able to fold it up when I don't have bikes on it is great too, that way I don't have to keep pulling it off my truck.  I also like the way it attaches to the hitch and the hitch locking mechanism.    All in all a great bike rack, I highly recommend it.
review.name: Best Bike Rack I've owned

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: I bought it but it won't screw in my hitch.  Then the rack shakes so much I am afraid my bike will fall.  I can't figure out what the screw is supposed to screw in.
review.name: Missing part

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike
review.reviewBody: Easy and convenient to use. Holds bike with no movement- I have the 2” receiver.
review.name: Excellent solid e-bike rack

name: T2 Pro XTR Hitch Rack - 2 Bike

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my old pair of Fox Ranger pants, the ones with the white fox logos instead of gray. The fabric is the perfect blend of being lightweight and stretchy as well as being very durable. I was excited to get a new pair this summer, however, these are not the same at all. They must have changed the fabric and the cut. They are significantly less well fitted (very baggy), the fabric stretched out in just a few months of wear, and you can see the small elastic fibers pilling through the fabric. I still love my old pair much more than these. I am pretty disappointed in the changes made for these new pair. I would not recommend these.
review.name: Not like my old pair

review.reviewBody: Great pack. Fit well and top quality. I bought this for a day hike through the Grand Canyon.
review.name: Awesome Pack

review.reviewBody: Best small bag I have ever had. Sorry I waited so long to get this. I use it every day walking around New York City.
review.name: Outstanding amazing backpack.

review.reviewBody: This was a gift for my husband, as I bought the women's version and love it.  This is a perfect size for a day hike.   He is able to have a jacket for either summer or winter, plus a full hydration bladder, food and my hiking first aid kit, and still have room for other items.  He found it easy to adjust to his body and was very comfortable.
review.name: Perfect Size for Day Hiking

review.reviewBody: The pack is smaller than it looks. It can't handle more than a couple of jackets, your water, a snack, and maybe your camera. But on the plus side, that's all you need for a day-hike. The lack of a top pocket hurts it, and the pack doesn't expand at all, so you're stuck with a fixed volume. It would be really difficult to do an overnight with it. The side straps annoyingly get in the way of your water bottle in/out, so I wound up undoing them and actually cutting them off.  On the plus side, for what it is, a comfy day pack, it's great. Very comfortable, easy access to the side pockets for water bottles (once you remove the straps), good belt with pockets for phone and lip balm, etc, good shoulder and chest straps, nice back ventilation, and stable. Fit is a bit of an issue. I'm 5'11" with a longish torso and this just barely fits. I'd like it slightly larger to properly sit on my hips. If you're 6' or over, this might not be the pack for you. Try before you buy.
review.name: Great Pack - Not Perfect

review.reviewBody: I needed something lighter and smaller for short day-trips in good conditions. This is it! The pack has no real support in the back panel, but you might expect that in a small pack like this. It's too small for winter use and can't handle much weight, but it's great for short trail hikes when you don't need a lot of extra clothing or gear. The pockets are small but handy. The back breathes well, and the waist belt is very comfortable.
review.name: Light, full-featured pack

review.reviewBody: Pack size is great. As always good quality. I would have prefered more zippered pockets both inside and out. Maybe add another color for trim.
review.name: Good Quality on the Miko 20

review.reviewBody: Great pack!  Fits better than expected.  So far no issues, great for one day hikes
review.name: Great Day Pack

review.reviewBody:
I have used it on a few day hikes, 5-8 miles. I was looking for a day pack, around 20L,  with a hip belt more than just webbing so the pack didn't move as much at the bottom. I narrowed it down to the fit and feel of the Gregory and two other brands. This one felt the best and had the features I was looking for more than the others. 

As a day pack the hip belt was what I wanted with two pouches on it for small items or easy snacks. The hip belt is comfortable and could be used for weight distribution if you packed a little more and heavier for kids, or a longer hike with more water and food. 

Probably the most room in a 20 L pack as well. I like the outer mesh pocket Gregory puts on their packs for easy access of jackets or whatever. The pack has a simple design but enough storage pockets overall.  

I did not have to adjust the pack, but adjusting the strap height for different torso sizes seems easy with the velcro. The shoulder straps are padded well and they form good when tightened.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this pack recently and am absolutely loving it. Some of my favorite features are the hip belts, the integration of the Gregory hydration reservoir, the pockets, and the back panel. It is rare to find a 20L pack that has such amazing and comfortable hip belts. Both sides have very nice pockets large enough to hold a phone or some snacks. I recently used this pack on a 20 mile day where I did a mix of hiking and running and never had any discomfort in the hips. The shoulder straps adjust exactly like a high quality backpacking pack allowing for optimal comfort and fine tuning which allows for a perfect fit! One of the defining features of this pack is the integrated hydration reservoir system. The large pocket closest to the handle has a hanger on the top which is designed specifically to hold the Gregory hydration reservoirs. Unlike other packs where the reservoir slides down to the bottom of the pack, this system maintains it vertical and in place no matter the activity level. The back panel like other Gregory packs is extremely breathable and comfortable. This helps maintain the temperature of your water, and has adjustability to make further adjustments to your shoulder straps. Aside from the comfort, adjustability, and thoughtful features, the Miko 20 packs a punch for space. There is enough space to easily pack for an overnight backpacking trip. With the right gear you can easily fit a sleeping bag, pad, shelter, water filter, food, backpacking stove and a light jacket  (bag and pad need to be very packable of course). I don't use poles when I hike, but there is an elastic cinch for collapsible poles on the side. Cinch straps on both sides of the frame can also be used for extra gear if needed. The only feature I would maybe add to this pack would be a cinch strap to hold gear on the top of the pack. It is a 20 L pack, so very pleased with all the amazing features it already has. This is an amazing pack and I would recommend it to any one who loves the outdoors and time in the mountains.
review.name: Amazing pack!

name: Miko 20L Daypack

review.reviewBody: I used the .3 and .4 zero friends in city of rocks on granite and they worked perfectly. I used them on both horizontal and vertical placements . I also like the extendable sling that they come with. The heads are narrow and worked great in small cracks and pockets.
review.name: Wild country zero friemds

review.reviewBody: good integrity, slightly gunky trigger action, similar to BD Z4’s but probably a bit more confidence inspiring
review.name: Zero Friend

review.reviewBody: Zero Friend cams are light, narrow and useful. I use them alongside CCH Aliens on my rack. I really like the extendable sling. It extends enough that I can often save a draw for later in the lead. The stem and trigger are about perfect. Easy to place, even with big fingers.
review.name: Zero Friends are awesome little cams

review.reviewBody: I have to say I have taken many whips on the blue .3 size that I bought and it is super confidence inspiring. I have the DMM dragonflies and the new Aliens as well to compare these to. I really like how flexible the aliens and dragonflies are however the more rigid stem of the zero friend does help when freeclimbing hard terrain when you press the trigger and the cam doesn't move as much as the other two... They still aren't fully rigid like a C3 or TCU so they don't walk easily.. They did a great job finding that middle ground between being flexible and rigid.

awesome little cam, surprised these haven't made as big a splash as the other micro cams coming out. I bought the .1-.3 and they feel like a mix between the new Z4 and the X4. they dont hold completely rigid when the trigger is pulled but on the smaller sizes that hasn't mattered much. on the upside, the head width is TINY which is crazy for how strong they are. Great cams!

I got these to compare to the Z4s and I have to say that they haven’t held up as well. I took them up a bigwall and they have permanent kinks in them that make it very difficult to actuate the mechanism.

I have to say a little disappointed with these cams.  I have recently switched all my old Bd cams to the friends and have been very happy. But... the zero friends have not bode well for me.  I have put very little use on them and my yellow and red both already have lobe issues and not from major falls. The other negative is the stems are very very floppy the whole cam will bend when squeezing the trigger similar to the x4’s I wish the stem was more rigid and they were tougher.  I don’t think I will get much more use out of them  unfortunately...

I purchased a full set of these a few months ago and, so far,  I really like them. I have a double rack of the friends, and I really like that the zero friends overlap the bottom three sizes. Similar to the friends, I really like the extendable slings. I think the friends are great cams, but I almost always find myself racking these instead of the smaller friends. The narrow head width is great. I had the chance to climb with the zero friends, X4s, and Z4s in the same day. The head width is just about the same. The zero friends are much stiffer than the X4s and slightly less stiff than the Z4s. The zero friends seem a bit better made (all metal) than the Z4s. I have a set of X4s and I haven't used them since I got the zero friends. I've taken a couple solid falls on the larger sizes and haven't fallen on the smaller sizes yet. The metal is a little softer than the friends, and seems to be a similar hardness to totem cams. I found some minor dents when I whipped on one, but the softer metal seems to provide good holding power with less surface area. I would recommend these to a friend and am considering a second set. The trigger action on some of the sizes isn't as smooth as I would like, but not to the point that it is noticeable when I am climbing and placing the cams.

review.reviewBody:
-SKU WFCA013-BLA-SRMATOISEV "Black, MMX-I-SPEC EV" is for shimano ISPEC EV shifter and sram MMX brake (wolftooth calls it ISEV-MM)

-SKU WFCA013-BLA-MMXEV "SRAM Matchmaker to I-SPEC EV" is for sram MMX shifter and ISPEC EV brake (wolftooth calls it MM-ISEV)
review.name: ISPEC EV and MMX clarification

review.reviewBody:
The MMX-ISpec EV only gives you a few millimeter gap from the bars. I run lockon grips, and the position of the shifter running the shiftmatch doesn't allow enough space for the grips. I had to bend a washer and sneak it between the shiftmatch and the ISpec-EV clamp to create enough space, and at that had to position my shifter *just* right to fit every thing in.

Wolftooth should recreate the exact spacing of the original matchmaker clamp and they clearly opted for ~3+mm closer to the bars.
review.name: MMX-ISpec EV doesn't play nice with AXS

name: Shiftmount

hasVariant.name: Pyrenees Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Pyrenees Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing Keen boots for many years. I'm a big fan of the wide toe box. I would, and do, recommend them for anyone who has wide feet like mine.

I like these boots fine. I could wish that the online photos showed the bright orange a bit more, it was a bit of a shock when I opened the package. 

The right boot caused painful binding around the right ankle at first, but that is easing up as they get broken in. I haven't experienced that with other Keen boots so it surprised me.

It seems you have shortened the laces since I last bought a pair. I had always thought they were a bit too long, so I was glad to see that. But now they seem a bit too short. Too short to tie a double knot. Also the laces you use always seem to come untied easily.

But those are minor complaints. In general, I really love Keen boots, and was happy to find this one at half price.
review.name: I have been wearing Keen

review.reviewBody: So far so good! I haven’t yet tested the boot under weight or wet conditions. There is more flexibility in the sole than expected. I sized as I would a running shoe, and the boot fits well with a heavy sock. I did have to lace with surgeon knots to keep my foot secure.
review.name: Classic backpacking boot

review.reviewBody: The boots are very comfortable! I don't need to break them in, just wear them. Will be great for shoveling snow.
review.name: The boots are very comfortable!

review.reviewBody: The nine was too big, 8 1/2 too small. I was very disappointed because the boots were just what I wanted.
review.name: Loved these boots but I couldn’t get them to fit!

review.reviewBody: All leather (quality leather) in the classic Keen fit. I’m on my fourth pair, including having new heals out on pair number 2 and 3.
review.name: Best Keen boots

review.reviewBody:
Super cute, and yes Keen is traditionally wider toe box than most shoes, but this style didn't come w wide sizing (I'm size 10). I have bunions and wearing these for a few hours w thin socks on my feet all day end up being a bit painful. Wearing them to work where I'm not on my feet all day, they're fine. I've had them for over a week and taking them on a hike finally today (I usually do 2-3 miles but we'll see if they start hurting). If you are someone who struggles with needing wide shoes, you might want to skip this style until they improve sizing options. 
The good part is that, since I have a high-volume feet (high arches + high top-of-foot), I can lace them loosely on that part & easily tighten on the ankle to create stability. The laces hold very well, no slippage at all. Soles are very comfortable. 
I'm keeping them for now, but we'll see after this hike. @Keen, please make wide sizes. Sizing up would be too long.
review.name: Need wide sizing

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! They are so incredibly cute and comfortable! I like the wide toe box! I always wanted a pair and I snatched them up at 50% off!! Delivery was on time!
review.name: Great Hikkng Boots!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love everything about this boot. No break in time, right out of the box fits true to size. I wish the insole had been softer, but removed it and installed a new different insole. Now the boot is perfect, which is why I gave a “4” rating instead of a “5”.
review.name: Softer insole

review.reviewBody: The sizing is perfect. Only took a few hours to break in. Stability protects my ankles. Firmness protects my feet. Expecting to wear these for many years to come.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keen has produced (and backs up) the only boot that really IS waterproof and that has a wide comfy toe box. Best women's boot on the market. I've worn Keens since turning 50, 30 years ago, when I did the Tour du mt Blanc.
review.name: Best boot ever!

name: Pyrenees Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great quality boot, I just wish the toebox wasn't so narrow.
review.name: Too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light Mid GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've had these boots for about 3 years now. I mostly use them for alpine climbing and scrambling with snowy/crampon approaches. These are the PERFECT boot for the Bugaboos or something similar. They are light enough you don't mind wearing them on the long hike with a massive bag to get up to Applebee campsite. I find they climb and edge really well on 4th/5th class terrain. The real winning aspect of these boots is they are so incredibly light. I am a 7.5 US women and I wear a 39 1/3, I would describe it as a performance fit but I actually have been enjoying that and haven't had any issues yet.
review.name: Lightest 3 season boot EVER!

name: Taiss Light Mid GTX Mountaineering Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excellent price for a great boots
review.name: Excellent price

review.reviewBody: I bought these on a 40% off clearance sale and they were arguably too inexpensive for the quality. Impeccable build quality. They are extremely stiff and took a good week or so of daily walks to get cozy. The extra removable tongue took a little getting used to but now is no issue. These feel so sturdy and tough and I expect they will last an extremely long time.
review.name: Incredible value

review.reviewBody:
This company’s incredible. The business model they have in place is a winner. The Lasportiva boots i purchased are wonderful. They’re true to size, so comfortable. Lacing system’s gr8. Like walking on pillows. The weight of the boots is perfect as well. I’ll for sure purchase more products from Backcountry in th future. Purchased th boots on line….four days later, pkg was @ my front door. I luv th boots and th warp speed delivery. Thanks Backcountry…you make it easy to be a satisfied customer. 
Jdee
review.name: luv th boots & th warp speed delivery

review.reviewBody: The boots are everything that my husband expected and then some, although this specific pair had to be returned for a size larger for comfort, awesome. The whole return process was easy and i received my right size within days of sending my returns back. Great customer service.
review.name: Good Boots!

review.reviewBody: Boots are very comfortable and supportive. NOT FOR FIREFIGHTING!!! I know it says in the description for post fire cleanup. But originally they were touted as firefighting boots. 1st pair....Throw away $350.00. The first version had massive failures due to delamination of the sole from the upper!! They then came out with these "WLF"(wildland firefighter). These were supposed to have an upgraded glue that could withstand the close proximity to the fire/fire line. NOPE!!!!! Another $375.00 down the drain. I also had trouble getting any help from La Sportiva. Additionally. The glue wont stand up to being kept in a "hot" environment. I have coworkers that had these boots delaminate while sitting in their trucks or in their "go bags" in the garage.
review.name: Not for F.F.!!!!

review.reviewBody: I now own two sets of the La Sportiva’s.  I’ll probably never switch boots unless they change something.  First set was the mountaineerings and now the glaciers.  They run a little small I learned with my first set.  I got a second set so they both will last a long long time.  I switch them out weekly.  I love these boots.
review.name: These Boots

review.reviewBody:
I was really hopeful that these boots would be great. 
What I found was that they feel like bricks with no give and very uncomfortable 
I really don't believe that any amount of break in would help. Had to return.
review.name: Bricks

review.reviewBody: I bought this boot 1 month ago. I have to wear a boot like this every day because of a mountain climbing accident that destroyed my right foot. This boots has got to be the best fitting and most comfortable boot I've ever had I highly recommend this boot.
review.name: My thoughts on this boots

review.reviewBody: Purchased 5 sets of boots that I thought would fit my needs.  My last pair of strictly hiking boots lasted 20 years and went all over the country.  Four test fits and four narrow fits.  I wear a medium wool sock with liner all the time with this type of boot.  This boot my foot slid in and had more than enough room but not too much.  I have learned the hard way on hot spots and blisters with my lighter hiking boots and fit.  I'll keep you posted on how they wear.  I do like their construction.  I like the additional padded tongue.  I like the lacing system and the sole.
review.name: Initial Review

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these but they do take some getting use to.  The first couple of times they bruised my ankle. I may have tied them too tight. But my foot was very comfortable. I love that there’s a little lift in them. I’m a shorty. I need all the help I can get.
review.name: The colors do it for me; mint green, chartreuse, hot pink & orange - love!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have bruises around the inside of my ankles  because of the hard shell.
review.name: GET new shoe laces!!!! I had to stop several times on my walk to tie and double knot laces!

comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: I love them they’re just what I wanted. The lacing up and untying are a little inconvenient but it’s because they’re such durable shoes.
review.name: Pretty colors functional and cozy

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love ❤️ these boots are so beautiful 🤩 not heavy and so comfortable the color is amazing
review.name: In love it ❤️

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the colors on these shoes! And the shape of the design is awesome, I feel so cool whenever I wear these. I got them to my size so they’re a bit snug with regular socks on. If you wanna wear thick socks with these I’d go half a size up.
review.name: Super stylish, if a bit tight

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great shoes for moderate hiking. And fashionable too
review.name: Bought these shoes at the last minute for a hiking trip to Utah and they were perfect for me. Very comfortable even before being broken in.  Gave me good traction on moderate trails and kept my feet plenty warm enough with wool socks. Go a full size up!

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted these to work sooooo badly. I loved the style and was looking for something different. I’m usually 8.5/9 and don’t have particularly wide feet (or at least have never had an issue before). I bought a 9 and they felt so weirdly tight even in thinner socks. Sized up to 9.5 and my toes still felt like they were on top of each other. Thankfully for Backcountry’s incredible customer service I’m able to exchange for another boot.
review.name: SUPER NARROW TOE BOX

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for two reasons; 1) They are really cute  2) I am weening myself off of a moon boot from a broken ankle and I thought the heal structure would be perfect for the transition, and they are. I was able to get the broken foot into the shoe for the first time this morning, because my foot was swollen.  The heal is perfect and I feel between the high top and the large/soft comfort of the heal it is a double bonus.  I am walking for the first time without a limp, oh. . . and did I mention they are very cool looking shoes?
review.name: Perfect shoe for recovering from ankle fracture

review.itemreviewed: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So many compliments and so comfortable!  You won’t regret purchasing.
review.name: LOVE

name: Kinetic Breakthru Venture Mid WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: So soft, lightweight, and cute! I sweat a lot and this dries quickly. I like that it’s flowy but not too oversized. The crop is perfect even for backpacking. Fits true to size - 34B 5’5” and Small fits perfect.
review.name: Get it!

review.reviewBody: Amazing lightweight fabric that does not cling to body. Cut nicely and a decent length (good for highwaist or midrise shorts, dimensions listed are correct). Even works with a few lowrise shorts, depending on the fit. The wide dropped shoulder seam is a little aesthetically awkward for me, but it does make the shirt perform very well as it doesn't restrict any upward arm movement. I was surprised to find it to be a good climbing shirt in addition to running. I bought my usual size and am happy, but I could have sized down as well. Would love to see more tops in this fabric! The tank is great too.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: So comfy, lightweight, and breathable--more colors please! <3
review.name: THE BEST

review.reviewBody: Can wait for long day on trails and outside - I have been looking for some lighter weight workout gear to go running and hiking in and these fit the bill! I also purchased the tank in the same material in all colors!
review.name: Super lightweight!

review.reviewBody: Super light, not too cropped and a bit longer in the back, just as pictured.   I’m 5’2, small fit perfectly.
review.name: Perfect fit, weight

hasVariant.name: Guide Pliers
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Guide Pliers online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Solid build, comfortable in the hand. Easy access holster.
It is the best fishing plier on the market. Truly an indispensable tool for a fishing guide.

I am so far very happy with them.  They are reluctantly replacing my 25 year old Van Staal titanium pliers.

Since Van Staal are no longer made in the US, I went this route.
review.name: Maike in America!

review.reviewBody: WOW!  These Guide Pliers are fantastic.  A lot of great thought went into the design; they’re lightweight, tough, and ergonomically perfect.  They cut braided line and monofilament quick and clean.  Moreover, the leather sheath looks great and is far superior to plastic.  I couldn’t be happier.  The best fishing pliers I’ve ever owned.

name: Guide Pliers

review.reviewBody: I love these outer shorts, super breathable, useful pockets, comfy on the bike, my favorite for hot days. This is my second pair. The inner short is ridiculously tight, like for a small child.  I’m 5’10,  145ish and a 30 in the baggy short fits great. I could hardly get the liner on and thought I might rip it trying. Way tighter than even Castelli stuff. I have other TLD gear, helmet, jerseys, etc. and the fit is spot on. Something went amiss with the size of these liners.  They were on sale, so I kept the outer short but will have to donate the liner to some kid.
review.name: Great baggy short, crazy tight liner

review.reviewBody: these come with a liner which i think is a little more snug than i prefer but they are of really nice quality and the shorts are perfect. i am super happy with this purchase. the zippers for the pockets are also very high quality, which is important.
review.name: first impression is great

review.reviewBody: Have tried TLD, Fox, Gore, Pearl Izumi, etc. For MTB shorts, these are my absolute favorite. Previous reviewer is correct that they are a little "sheer", but they are intended to be used with good undershorts!
review.name: My fav

review.reviewBody: These are see through! Just looks weird.
review.name: So much air you can see stuff

review.itemreviewed: RC903 Limited Edition S-PHYRE Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I switched from cheaper carbon shoes to these and I was surprised by how much stiffer and lighter these felt! The fastening is comfortable and I didn't feel the pinching I felt with my other shoes. The foot arch insert was a nice touch, making the shoes very adjustable for personal preference.

These run small for me, about 1 size smaller. I usually wear size 40 for my dress shoes, but for these 41 fits perfect.
review.name: Great comfort and power transfer!

review.itemreviewed: RC903 Limited Edition S-PHYRE Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes look great and the new Boa closures are a nice upgrade to the prior generation.
review.name: Great upgrade to a great shoe

review.itemreviewed: RC903 Limited Edition S-PHYRE Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I thought my feet would not fit into size 39, but they did and the shoes are comfortable. I feel more power transmission to the pedals then my old (more then 10 yr) SIDI shoes, thanks to the carbon fiber soles. The wire locks work well and can be tightened while riding. The only thing that is a mystery are the inserts that came with the shoes, that I do not know what to do with.
review.name: The anticipated pain is somehow missing

name: RC903 Limited Edition S-PHYRE Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My left foot loves these shoes. However the right foot pokes into my forefoot where the toes bend and it has bruised my foot. I tried to have them warrantied, but Sorel just said the case was closed. I have 6 other pairs of sorel boots and don't have this problem in any of them.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The lateral arch is slightly elevated leading to rubbing on the medial ankle.

comment: Hello Nicole, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry OUT N ABOUT™ IV Classic Women's Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Sorel actually replaced my last pair of these under warranty which is incredible service IMO. No one else does this. Incredibly comfortable and  stylish, and waterproof too. Great boots.
review.name: Love these boots

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are very comfortable and I loved them until they started leaking. I thought Sorel had a better product than this. The glue used along the top of the boot has pulled away and now the boot leaks in rain or snow. For only wearing them a occasionally throughout two years, I am shocked this company does not stand behind their product but instead insists on a 'one year limited life-time' warranty. Sad for Sorel as you will continue to lose customers
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Hello Sgreen, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have loved these boots for over a year. They are warm, very comfortable and the color I have, black and sparkly silver is so cute. 

Unfortunately, the shoe is coming unglued from the sole and the trim is coming unglued.  It is incredibly disappointing as I expect better quality from Sorel.
review.name: Not holding up over time
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have always loved this brand and have been wearing my last pair for a few years.  Happy to share this arrived in great condition and looks exactly as pictured on site   The boots is attractive and comfortable.  I do wish the brand would make wide width options.
review.name: Great purchase

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Box arrived damaged and the tan pair arrived with several scuffs on them, appearing to have been worn. 
The boots themselves are pretty cute. I like last year’s version much more though. Ordered half a size up because last year’s were a little snug in my normal size. These are almost too big, they fit weird and are heavier.  
The black and chalk ones - the rubber lower portion is a tan yellow, NOT off white like the photos make them appear. Likely returning.
review.name: Not in love
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Classic Duck Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I absolutely LOVE these shorts. I got them in the Granite Green Parke Print last July ('21) and they quickly became my most favorite water activity/camping/etc shorts. They are so comfortable and easy breezy. Love the material; it's soft and quick-drying. I also really enjoy the color.

One small con: They're not designed for wide hips. I got them in the XL and my hips are usually around 43-45". I am 5'9" and usually a 14-16. The placement and design of the pockets makes it so the outer fabric of the pocket sticks out kind of weirdly and can make my hips appear even wider. It doesn't matter though. These are so comfortable that although they aren't super flattering on *my* figure, I am fully willing to let it go.

I'm incredibly bummed that it looks like they're discontinuing the Pecos Water Short. If I had paid attention, I would have gotten a pair in every color offered.

Backcountry: plz bring them back!
review.name: Best water activity shorts!

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: I now own three pairs in different colors. I wear these all summer long for kayaking, paddleboarding, hiking, walking, traveling, or housework. The zippered hideaway pocket helps me make sure I don't lose my keys in the water, and the fabric is still comfortable when I'm soaking wet after jumping in the lake!
review.name: My favorite shorts

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the best hiking shorts I've ever owned. They stretch and move very well, and are snug but forgiving around the waist so you're not constantly pulling them up while on climbs or scrambles. They dry very quickly. They're light enough that you can layer them under pants, but they're sturdy enough that you're not afraid to rip them. I bought a second and third pair because I can't imagine hiking in anything else.
review.name: The best hiking shorts

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: I just wore these on a two-day river trip and I love them! Good fit, fast-drying, comfortable, and look good. My only complaint is that the pockets droop out and become inside-out when you're in the water for too long and it looks kind of gross. All you have to do is tuck them back in, but I'd just prefer if the pockets were more secure.
review.name: Great shorts, but

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered these shorts and a pair from Stoic (I think they?re called River Shorts) at the same time, and these were the winner!  The fabric is light but not see-through, and the cut and stretch allow full range of motion without either gaping or getting stuck on my thighs.  Some athletic/hiking shorts at this inseam are either so wide in the leg that I risk flashing my kids when I sit on the ground to play with them or the shorts bind up on my (athletically built) thighs; but these are just right.  I?m usually a size 4 in most brands, somewhere between straight and curvy, and the S fit well.  I?m back on the website to pick out a second color!
review.name: Back for more

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was given this product by Backcountry but this is my honest opinion. I was in love with these shorts the second they came out of the box. The material is so soft and stretchy and move with you when they are dry or if they get wet. The material also dries quickly which is a huge plus when paddle camping with a very large dog who thinks everyone needs to be as wet as he is. These shorts are extremely comfortable to wear hiking, paddling or around town. I wear a small in these and they fit like a glove. The length is also generous and flattering being a little taller and I’d say they are high rise-ish at the waist.  Sooo happy about the pockets and they’re mesh which I’d count as a double win so they won’t hold water! I went with the yellow. I was slightly hesitant at first and was like ehh maybe I’ll really like it and yes I actually love the color!
review.name: You?ll wear these all summer!

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: I originally ordered these shorts in a medium but was surprised that they were too big. I don't remember the last time I bought a small in shorts or pants but I ordered a small in these on the second try and they fit great! I wear them constantly and actually haven't even had them around water yet. They are comfy, lightweight, and are a flexible fabric that feels quite different from Patagonia Baggies or other water shorts.
review.name: Great product, sizing felt off for me

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody:
"I was given this product by Backcountry, but this review is my personal opinion."

I won't lie- I'm generally suspicious of water shorts. They are either very itchy & uncomfortable, have horrible built-in mesh undies, or are so short I'm not sure what the point of wearing them over bathing suit bottoms is if my own bottom is going to be hanging out. I generally find a pair of very thin, black, and light-weight running shorts with a drawstring I can pull tight and just use those.

I was a bit nervous with these, being true "water shorts" and being bright yellow- but I was pleasantly surprised. They are a good length, cover everything I want to be covered (even when lying down on a surfboard), have no annoying built-ins, and are a quick drying material. I also really like the fact that they still have pockets! I especially like the nice little zippered security pocket for a little cash and my valet key, and the fact that the other pockets are mesh or have a drainage hole so they don't get heavy. I also like that they aren't so tight that I get those awk bathing suit lines showing through, even with having the lightest color available.

I will say, I am more inclined to use these for days on the boat or over my bathing suit after a surf session than when I'm actually surfing. The fabric is just a tiny bit bulky to want to wear while on the board (a blend between this water fabric and the 'on the go' short softer fabric may be the perfect solution for this).

There are comments on fit from others, and I can confirm that as a pretty straight-built lady with not- so wide hips they fit very well. Though I still am a bit surprised that I am an XS in all of my Backcountry shorts as I am normally a S (size 2-4) in other brands.
review.name: Watershort Win

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody:
If you?ve got curves, may not be the shorts for you. I ordered by my hip size and the waist was enormous, fit perfectly at the hips and small towards the legs.

If you?re more of a straight build, may work well. Great material and very light feeling.
review.name: Weird fit

review.itemreviewed: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's
review.reviewBody: These fit well, and look great in black. But the logo is too much. I want tech clothes so I can jump in the kayak but I want them to be flexible and stylish enough to wear to my pre hike brunch.  They would be pretty perfect except for the logo.  I live in a city and bike a ton so I don't not appreciate the reflective tush goat, but 99% of the time I don't want that lewk.
review.name: Almost

name: Pecos Water Short - Past Season - Women's

I'm used to riding an XC bike and rode Vittoria Mezcal/AKA/Saguaro for a long time...I'm getting used to a bigger, burlier bike/tire and slowly testing the limits of cornering...seems like these will do the trick. Super stable and tough tire, rolls well at about 18 psi.
review.name: Great tire

review.reviewBody: I highly recommend the Nitro Incline boots for anyone looking for the ideal blend of comfort and performance, especially splitboarders. The liner is incredibly comfortable and molds to my foot perfectly.  I was really impressed with the walk mode; it provides a great range of motion and makes traversing feel natural. I much prefer the TLS+ lacing system over BOA because I find it quicker and easier to get a secure fit.  Boots translate absolute control on the board!
review.name: My go-to splitboard boots

review.reviewBody: I bought the 2024 model to replace a pair of Deeluxe's XV that fell apart. There is not much difference with this year's other than improvements in the TLS and the gusset. As good as advertised. Rigid enough off the box (I have not adjusted the rigidity yet) easier to put on or take off than the Deeluxe's. Even less volume. Heels locked in place.
review.name: Solid freeriding boots

name: Incline TLS PowerCord Snowboard Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody:
Less than a year after purchase , the hose on this pump tore right off. I was in the middle of changing a tire on the side of the road and was left with a flat and no air to fill it. Walking home several miles with a bike on your shoulder will really make you hate a failed pump.

The point of the design is to have the flexibility of a hose for an easier time connecting/disconnecting from the tube valve stem. However, the crimp of metal around the hose appears to create a weak point and it split. I heard the air whooshing out and as I was investigating the problem the hose just tore right off.
review.name: Valve hose breaks easily

review.reviewBody: Super small and super light, oil silc color looks amazing, quality wise it does decent job when u need
review.name: Piece of art

name: Pocket Drive Pro Pump

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this backpack. I loved the vintage look and all of the pockets. I intended this bag as a carry-on. I wanted it do be durable and be able to last a number of years of use. I have had it for 2 months and there are already several tears at the seams around patchwork, zippers, and pockets. The stitching isn't durable at all and the bag cannot handle wear or weight. The photos made the bag look like canvas; however, it's just fake canvas made of cheap polyester. The metal zippers on each side pocket are sharp and tend to tear/snag on other fabrics. Won't buy this bag or probably any other Kelty bag again after attempting to repair the bag myself.
review.name: Hard No

description: Buy the Metolius Speedster Rope Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speedster Rope Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Metolius Speedster Rope Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I use this as my gym bag and for that it's perfect.  I can fit a 40m rope, harness, shoes, chalk bag, belay device (with carabiner), belay glasses, and a large water bottle without issue.  There's a small zip pocket on the front that I use for tape, liquid chalk, nail clipper, wallet, and keys.

Getting a rope in there takes a bit of getting used to but once you've mastered rolling it up and sort of jiggling it to the bottom you're good to go.  I imagine you'll have far less room for stuff if you're hauling a full 70+m cord.

Construction is good.  Nicely sewn shoulder straps and an outer shell that has no problem taking the abuse of dragging it around a gym three days a week.  There's a small strap on the front that snaps closed (I imagine to keep it from unzipping) and the metal on the rivet itself actually broke after a few weeks but I replaced it with a rivet snap for $3.

All told, well worth the $35 I paid for it.
review.name: Perfect gym pack

review.reviewBody:
This is a solid and durable rope bag. The backpack straps and accessory pocket are both nice touches. If you just want to carry a rope and maybe a pair of shoes to the crag, and have a partner willing to carry everything else, this could be a reasonable option.

My main annoyances come from the bag?s shape. If you fold and roll a flaked rope on the tarp in the normal way (fold in the sides, roll it toward the bag) you end up with a roll that?s the wrong shape to fit in the bag. You end up trying to cram a side-to-side cylinder (the rope) into the up-and-down cylinder (the bag). You can mitigate this with some careful folding and rolling, but even still I find that a burly 60M crag rope (Mammut Workhorse 9.9) requires some cramming and profanity to get the zipper closed on this bag.  The end result is a tightly packed bag with a very defined shape, which is rather annoying to fit inside a larger backpack. 

Overall I prefer rope bags that pack more loosely and then can be cinched down with straps, like Metolius Ropemaster or BD Super Chute. These are both easier to load, and more malleable when cramming them inside a crag pack.
review.name: Does the job but better options exist

name: Speedster Rope Bag

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am not happy about writing my disappointment of this last pair of Keens that I purchased and have now returned. In fact this is my second pain of Keens that have not met up to my expectations.

I have been able to purchase size 8. 5 ladies Keen shoes for almost 20 years without ever having to try them on and they fit perfectly without any need to "Break-in" But my last 2 purchases have even come close to that statement. First - After trying to convince myself that the hiking boots I purchased about a year ago would improve - I finally gave them to a non-profit for sale. Thinking that was a one off, I ordered the Targhee (I have worn out my prior pair i owned) Unfortunately - Keen has changed there shoe moulds or manufacturer or both. I put them on, walked around the house, put them back in the box and asked for a refund. It just was not comfortable!

I will be looking for another brand to fill my needs on supportive walking and hiking from now on. Still wearing my old black causal shoe from years gone by - but they will be my last.
review.name: Disappointment after over 10 years of wearing Keens

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have "peasant" feet as my mother used to say - wide with big toe the longest. Hard to fit w USA sizing but Keen works. My last pair of Targhee lasted almost 10 years. This new pair is comfortable right out of the box and I can wear hiking Sox with them. Honestly can't say enough good things!
review.name: Awesome trail shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is probably my third or fourth pair of similarly styled keens. I used to get the vouyagers (probably spelled that wrong) but I wanted waterproof this time since I am always helping my children across streams and getting wet feet. I sized up because they say that the waterproof version runs smaller, but I ended up having to return to get my original size anyway. I do wish there was one more set of lacing loops so I could lace closer to my shin, but ultimately I love these shoes.
review.name: Good shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought them knowing I would change the orange laces. (Not my color). I am a solid size 10 but find these to be roomier than other Keen boots I have bought before. I find them hard to cinch up and still move around in them with thicker socks.
review.name: Keen women’s waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shoes and buy a new pair every year or 2. I am very hard on shoes and they put up with a lot. The only thing is these last pairs I got for myself and my husband seem to run bigger than the last ones. They are the same size and same exact shoe so I don't know why. But I have not found any shoes that are as comfortable and durable as these!!
review.name: Wonderful shoes

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: My 3rd pair. I live in these shoes. Comfort. . style. . support. . I feel good knowing my feet are dry and safe.
review.name: Happy feet

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My heel slips a bit. Less so since the pull throughs for the laces loosened up, but still may be a concern for longer distance, not sure yet.
review.name: Fantastic!!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the best shoes for my bad feet with bunions. These are the shoes my podiatrist recommends. They are awesome
review.name: Best shoes

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe, I live on a farm. Outside, no matter what the conditions. This shoe holds up, keeps my feet warm/dry. Only 4 stars because did the toe box get smaller? by a little? 
I usually have no trouble at all right out of the box. 
I love my Keen shoes. They get better with time. Thank you!
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got them for work, but I don’t want to ruin them just yet, I continue to wear my old beat up ones for work. (My dog got a hold of them). I think I’ll go ahead and order another pair so I can keep one pair nice. They’re the only shoes my feet like that I can wear all day.
review.name: I love my keens

name: Targhee II Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness Speedplay Standard Tension Cleat online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speedplay Standard Tension Cleat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness Speedplay Standard Tension Cleat online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They weren’t compatible with my original speedplay pedals.
review.name: Didn’t Work

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using Speedplay pedals for years. Love them. I like these clips. I live in cornfield country. So when I ride, I stop in the small town fuel station to top off my water bottle. These clips makes walking inside for the water so much better
review.name: I’ve been using Speedplay pedals

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using Speedplay pedals since 2003.  The Wahoo standard cleats are very different.  They are extremely difficult to clip into and to unclip. I rate them as dangerous as unclipping in an emergency requires anticipating using lots of extra force to unclip.  I don’t recommend. They should be recalled.
review.name: Very, very difficult clip in and out.

review.reviewBody: I ride 120+ miles per week. The new cleats replaced a pair that were several years old. They were super easy to install. Spring tension seemed overly firm for the first ride, but I quickly got used to it. The new cleats better for walking - no more digging up wooden floors! Highly recommended.
review.name: Near Perfection

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, Wahoo slightly changed the design of speedplay pedals and cleats, which I did not know before ordering these. Since I have multiple sets of Speedplay-created speedplay pedals on bikes and the new cleats do not work well with those, the purchase of these cleats was unfortunately a waste of money. I wish I had known about the incompatibility in advance (not to mention what a bad decision it was for wahoo to create that incompatibility!)
review.name: Don’t get these if you have Speedplay-created pedals - Wahoo created incompatibility!

review.reviewBody: Wahoo has taken all the negative aspects of the Speedplay cleat system and redesigned them out.  After a brief break in these cleats are amazingly reliable and durable as well as comfortable to walk on.
review.name: Upgrade your Speedplay experience

review.reviewBody: The cleats work well and I love the built in plastic covers, so walking is quieter and safer than the original Speedplay cleats. My only gripe is that "standard tension" is significantly stiffer than my old cleats. Thankfully I was able to disengage on the third attempt and didn't hit the pavement.
review.name: Upgraded design. Misleading tension descriptor.

review.reviewBody: The quality of the cleat seems to have dropped off in the past few years. While the cleat covers have advanced to a point they are AWESOME the cleat itself now feels "cheap" and the way it engages and disengages is not crisp like in the past... they feel "sloppy" I never had this issues with cleats up until the past year.
review.name: Cleats feel cheap and sloppy.

review.reviewBody: They’re cleats. How excited can you get? Make sure to lubricate before each ride
review.name: They’re cleats. How excited can

review.reviewBody: Since Wahoo bought Speedplay the tolerances on the cleats has changed.  Every time I replace the cleats at least one of the screws strips.  This never happened when Speedplay owned the company.  I wish Wahoo would revise these to their previous quality.
review.name: Not what they used to be

name: Speedplay Standard Tension Cleat
