review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mons Cube S Mountaineering Boot
review.reviewBody: I had purchased the G2 Evo's for a previous climb size 42.5 and the boots worked very well so I stayed with La Sportiva.  The Mon's are well made but I didn't quite like the feel of the inner boot.  There are basically 3 components of this boot.  You have the slipper, the inner boot and the outer boot.  The slipper fits well and is comfortable.  The outer boot is well made and lighter than I thought they would be when you look at the bulk of the boot.  The inner boot does not come with any arch support and has a Velcro strap that tightens it.  So, I went with a half size larger and purchased the Intuition boot liners that in my opinion are warmer and have a lace up front that gives me a better fit.  These boots did come with a footbed, but it is flat with little or no arch support.  I removed it and used a Red Wing multipurpose revolution orthotic footbed. Now I have a boot that fits quite well and provides strong support for both of my feet.
review.name: Mons Cube modified

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mons Cube S Mountaineering Boot
review.reviewBody: The most painful high altitude boots that I have ever had. Each step with pain on the route, still can't recover after almost 2 months after Denali summit this June... very disappointed, don't know what to do - these are the most expensive boots in my life and such a bad inner liner blocking the blood circulation and making the bones rubbed up (i ordered 2-3 sizes up and I'm 10 years of experience in high altitude mountanering). All my boots are la sportiva but these are a huge regret and disappointment.
review.name: The most painful high altitude boots

review.itemreviewed: Olympus Mons Cube S Mountaineering Boot
review.reviewBody: Ordered and tried on (in my house) many of the other 8000m boots an though this was the most intuitive, easiest to use w/ gloves on and it had the most normal fit- think I have a normal shaped foot. The inner boot did rub raw and bruised my shin- even after wearing for many miles on different trips. And I noticed this with others on big mtns with this boot. Also recommend a foot bed/insole -consider size up- as otherwise it's a flat boot.
review.name: Great boot

name: Olympus Mons Cube S Mountaineering Boot

review.reviewBody:
“I recently purchased a Cotopaxi Allpa 35L Travel Pack and a Teca Fleece Pullover, and I couldn’t be happier with my experience!

First, the quality is outstanding. The travel pack is rugged yet lightweight, with thoughtful compartments that make organizing so easy. It’s perfect for both weekend trips and longer adventures. The fleece is incredibly soft and warm, and the bright, colorful design gets compliments everywhere I go.

I also love that Cotopaxi is a sustainable brand. Knowing that my purchases are made with recycled materials and support ethical manufacturing practices makes me feel good about spending a bit more. Their commitment to giving back through their foundation is the cherry on top.

While the price is on the higher side, the quality and mission behind the brand make it totally worth it. Plus, their lifetime warranty gives me extra peace of mind.

If you’re looking for outdoor gear that performs well, looks great, and supports a greater cause, Cotopaxi is the way to go!”
review.name: Cotopaxi Rate 5/5

review.reviewBody:
I have been looking for a pullover coat to add to my winter arsenal and this coat nailed it!! This coat has a side zipper that makes it so easy to get into. The front zipper is generous so you can unzip and cool off because this coat is nice and warm.
The front pocket is ample for mittens / cell phone and there is also a large zip pocket.
I get so many compliments on the coat, especially the colors (I got the yellow one ). It is also long enough to cover your bum to keep it warm!!
I recommend this coat 100%!
review.name: Great Coat!!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket, it is so soft and comfortable and the weight is perfect. I have even worn mine indoors at convention centers watching my daughter play volleyball and it’s been amazing!!
review.name: My favorite jacket this winter ❄️

review.reviewBody:
Love the colors. The fit is good as long as you err on larger size. If between small and medium I'd go for medium on jackets. 
Price is high unless on sale. 
As far as durability goes - time will show
review.name: Good jackets

review.reviewBody: A lot of favorites with this. I really like the zipper on the side. It helps make it larger so that I can take it off easier, as well as put it on. The big pocket on the stomach is perfect for my phone and keys. When I wear this I like to keep it light and not have a bag with me. The pockets are plentiful. I also want to share that with a long sleeved shirt you are super warm and cozy. Highly recommend. True to size, even with a larger chest.
review.name: Cozy and warm

review.reviewBody: I hours this to wear for traveling between the Caribbean and the north eastern part of the US during the winter months. I’ve been looking for a down packable that was both warm and gave decent coverage, this hit all the marks. I sized myself based off of my hip measurement and that worked. I went one up from my usual size (ordered and XL) and I do wish that I would’ve just stuck with my regular size (L). It’s okay, I definitely have plenty room for layers now.
review.name: Perfect packable

review.reviewBody: The perfect comfortable, warm, but not restrictive jacket in beautiful colors. Sized up to fit a thicker sweater underneath and it’s perfect.
review.name: It’s perfect

review.reviewBody: My new best friend of a coat in the chilly northeast. Great with a single base layer in the 30s, and warm in the teens with base layer+fleece. This light weight coat packs a big warm punch. Only caution: the zippers do get caught on the material. So be careful as you're sliding the side zipper, in particular.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Just awesome. I love it. Light, but warm. I'm pretty critical when it comes to sizing so I'm going to say it fits true to size. :)
review.name: Fuego Down Hooded Pullover

review.reviewBody: I love the down feeling of this jacket! I don't usually buy yellow but I've gotten lots of compliments on this jacket. Lightweight and so warm!
review.name: Love my jacket

name: Fuego Down Hooded Pullover - Women's

review.reviewBody: Starting this review by stating that the quality is exceptional with hefty fleece feel, normally go for 7” shorts but wanted to try a 5” for those days that are not so cool. review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Exceptional service from Backcountry.  Patagonia Down Sweater misses the mark.  I have an older one, but needed a size down and one with a hood.  I ordered an XL as I am an XL now in all other Patagonia jackets.  It is very generous in cut, I could have gone with a large easily.  The biggest down side is that the new recycled content fabric is not pure black.  It's very blue and blue/gray.  I'm returning and browsing other options.
review.name: Black is grey/navy and fit is generous

review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second down jacket of this model to own. My first is 9years old and still kicking! Decided to upgrade to the hooded version. It’s just as amazing as the original. Sizing was exactly the same for me. I’ve always worn a medium in Patagonia & this jacket wasn’t any different.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I usually wear a size medium, but I feel like it’s almost a little too big. I tried on the small and it’s almost a little too snug. I wish there was a size in between lol. But other than that I love the color and quality!
review.name: Almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am 5’5” at 130 pounds- order a medium! Large was huge. Sizing reviews made me worry it ran small. Its does not.
review.name: Dont order up a size

review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love this jacket! It does what I need it to do, it fits great and keeps me warm.

I normally wear a medium but I like to wear layers under it so a large gave me a little more room
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I just received the jacket that I ordered that was supposed to be black, unfortunately, it came and is actually a navy blue. I am very disappointed since the tag says black. Definitely don’t recommend ordering from this site if you want a black puffer.
review.name: Jacket is not actually black

review.itemreviewed: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've worn this a few times so far. It seems very warm for it's weight! The only issue I have is with the sizing. I'm somewhat curvy and find the bottom hem runs a bit tight. According to Patagonia size chart I can wear a medium but I sized up in this jacket and still don't have a lot of layering room around the hips due to the straighter cut. The upper body/shoulders/chest is perfect but the lower body fit is definitely slimmer than the Nano Puff Jacket. Size up one size and you should be fine! Sizing aside, highly recommend!
review.name: Almost perfect

name: Down Sweater Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the NRS Super Stretch Neoprene Cockpit Cover online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Super Stretch Neoprene Cockpit Cover
hasVariant.description: Buy the NRS Super Stretch Neoprene Cockpit Cover online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Seems like a running issue: The drawstring is too short.  The cover fits the cockpit on my Pelican Potomac 100ES great and will fit with the drawstring knotted at the very ends but it takes two people or a bunch of fiddling.  I want to put this cover on by myself so I'm just buying 5/16" bungee cord to replace the drawstring with a decent length one that I can pull tight and tie.
review.name: Drawstring Too Short

review.reviewBody: I purchased this cover in the universal plus size which is advertised for cockpit lengths 40"-57".  My cockpit measures 48" x 25" so it was right in the middle of the plus size cover. After several attempts I was unable to stretch this cover the full length of my cockpit. I mean really stretching it to its limits with two people on a 90 degree day it was well short. Also, be aware that the shock cord internal to the out hem is not prevented from retracting inside the hem when stretching. I had to spend some time fishing it out in order to return the cover. The cover is very well made and of good quality but the advertised size is not correct.
review.name: Doesn't fit my Pelican Pioneer 100XR

review.reviewBody: I put the cover on my Jackson Tupelo 12 ft. today and it was a bear. I lost the drawstring in the cover cause there wasent a knot in the ends, so I pulled those out. Struggled with the install cause I'd newer done one before. Once I figured it out the fit was ABSOLUTELY PERFECT without the drawstring.  This is the big one, the Super Stretch Universal PLUS.
review.name: Very happy.

name: Super Stretch Neoprene Cockpit Cover

review.reviewBody: works great. Filter body is > 20 years old and have only replaced cartridges and some o-rings. No odor or bad taste in filtered water despite filtering out of some putrid stock tanks. Friends filter resulted in tainted water taste.
review.name: works great. Filter body is

review.reviewBody: Difficile a savoir comment installer, car différent de l'original, mais fonctionne tr`s bien
review.name: Difficile a savoir comment installer,

review.reviewBody:
I own several MSR water filter pumps. I became frustrated with the slow flow even after cleaning. I thought I'd buy a new ceramic, instead of a whole new pump.
Outstanding choice!!! It like a brand new pump. I couldn't be happier and I saved $ as well.
review.name: Couldn't be happier

review.reviewBody: I’m glade I purchased this filter at this time because it revealed just how good the existing filter was and I learned what the caliper gauge was and how to use it thanks to warranty department providing instructions
review.name: This filter was intended to be a backup.

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent product , my last one I used for over a decade. It’s a very reliable and user friendly design. Also the customer service is excellent. I really think these people in this company actually care about the customer.
review.name: This is an excellent product

review.reviewBody: 1. Thank You for continuing to offer the ceramic filter for the water purifier. 2. I have used your water filter and your little backpacking stove for many, many ears. Outstanding equipment !
review.name: water filter and backpack stove

review.reviewBody: I have had the Waterworks EX (Mini Waterworks) for more than 6 years. It has never let me down. I have had companion climbers/trekkers who had filters clog up in their (non MSR) units and they become non functional. I can take this one apart and gently scrub the outside of the filter, put it back together and be back to brand new function in less than 10 minutes. Awesome!
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: I have a circa 1992 Waterworks filter that I used long ago and put back into storage. After contacting MSR to see if I could use this cartridge in my old filter, (they responded with an email confirmation), I purchased this. Took it on a recent 5-day trip to Norther Wisconsin. Initially in a tannin-filled lake, it pumped quickly. Then it plugged up after 1.5 liters (hard pumping, trickle). I took out the cleaning pad, cleaned and got it working again at full-rate. It regularly plugged but I was warned that this would occur in this type of water. As we paddled to other lakes, I found that the performance improved (could pump 4+ liters of water with no cleaning necessary). There was one other filter in the group and people were impressed with this filter's performance and field maintainability. The filter then would not draw water in on the suction stroke. I took it apart, and found that there was grit in the umbrella valve. Cleaned it and put the pump back together and it worked flawlessly again. I'm highly impressed with the overall performance. I like the internal carbon matrix that can also filter out bad taste.
review.name: Solid performer

review.reviewBody: I've never had a slight question about these filters effectiveness. I depend on them to keep me safe on the trail and happy when I return home.
review.name: Have been using these filters for Years

review.reviewBody: I have had a WaterWorks filter for years. The only time I had to replace the filter was because I dropped it on cement while cleaning it. I do try to filter the cleanest water I can find and, when it is cloudy (full of St. Helen's ash for instance) I collect it in a bucket and let it settle before filtering if possible.
review.name: Love these filters

name: MiniWorks/WaterWorks Ceramic Filter Element

description: Buy the Simms Wading Staff online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wading Staff
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Wading Staff online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this because of an upcoming trip to the Driftless region of WI, which has some steep banks to traverse.  I've been stubbornly resisting the need for one of these for years, but accepted the fact that I need one after absolutely destroying my knee while wading in the Bighorn River in MT.  Now that I have a knee replacement, this is a tool I can no longer deny the usefulness of.  Really solid construction, and it feels like it'll hold up well.  It is easy to collapse and easy to assemble.  I really like the formed shell pouch, but would like to see it accommodate a 2" wader belt with loops for wearing horizontally across my back.  That's not a complaint, just an improvement I'd like to see.  I do not care for the cord lanyard that connects it to the zinger....It will get snagged and tangled, and seems like an afterthought on an otherwise well-designed product.  The positives definitely outweigh the negatives!!
review.name: Good quality overall

review.reviewBody: I think it’s amazingly made very sturdy. I wish it was adjustable for my height. I’m 5’2” and the height of the handle is awkward. When I fish and am standing in the river I need to leave it extended and it’s very hard to manage. Yesterday the fly line got tangled in the staff while I was trying to land a fish. I think a women’s version would be grand!
review.name: Women dimensions needed

review.reviewBody: Solid product. Here is my review https://youtu.be/AY0qYYSfP5g?si=86aJYlwvXJ2Yxjej
review.name: Solid Product with Design in Mind

review.reviewBody: This is a great wading staff. Wish it were maybe another 1/4 inch in diameter, otherwise pretty stable.
review.name: GOOD STAFF FOR LOW TO MODERATE WATER.

review.reviewBody: The idea of a staff in the river is good but you have to plan to leave it extended as it's a 2 handed job to put it away. Also wish they had two different lengths. I'm short and this is overkill length for me.
review.name: Good but could use improvements

review.reviewBody:
I have not had a chance to use it yet. 
Therapy older I get I find the more I need support crossing a river. I replaced the tip with the rubber one. 
Very good quality 
Looking forward to getting it wet.
review.name: Support

review.reviewBody: Great product ... its my third Simms wading staff. One bent after falling on it crossing a river in Montana and another snapped in two after a bad fall negotiating high spring water in Colorado.  I would NEVER BE ON A STREAM WITHOUT THIS PRODUCT.  It has saved me too many times to count.  Over the last 60 years years I used a lot of different wading staffs and this is the best.  One thing I don't care for is the way they have integrated the holster and the retractable leash.  I would much rather have two separate components - I never bother using the holster.  I sling it over my right shoulder when not in use.
review.name: ESSENTIAL FOR STREAM FISHERMEN

review.reviewBody: Simple design, easy to use, & very tough. It keeps my 6’3 250# frame out of the rivers.
review.name: Did I mention how tough this product is?

review.reviewBody: I never thought I would ever "need" a wading staff or even consider using one before my friend convinced me to get one. Now it's definitely something I always have with me now on anytime I'm on the water, my only regret was not buying one sooner.
review.name: worth the money!

review.reviewBody: With such high water flows in Utah right now haven’t been able to use it yet. Upon inspection at delivery the construction, feel, ease of putting together and strength of materials put it in the win column for me. Tried other ones (cheaper) and ideas with no satisfaction. Spend the extra money and be happier. Also at my age it’s a lot more about safety than the extra cost. Fish hard. Fish well. Enjoy life.

name: Wading Staff

review.reviewBody: Got these grips in the mail today and put them on my mountain bike.  Easy to install and very comfortable.  Light.  Singular clamp is holding well.  Outer end of the grip is capped with the same soft grip material so it won't scratch my car like my last grips.  Great handle.  I think these will be my new favorites if they last.
review.name: Great grips

review.reviewBody: I've been riding ODI Rogues for a few years but these thinner Reflex grips are less of a handful but just as comfortable. I have the Reflex on an E-bike and the ODI on two different acoustic bikes.
review.name: Thinner comfort

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoe is a slip on - and its hard to get into. Theres not a zipper on the side and its gors above the ankle. So it's a bit uncomfrotable and not fun to take on and off. I returned the shoes
review.name: Hard to get on and off
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve.

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my daughter and was instantly so jealous that I bought myself a pair as well. They are so comfortable!
review.name: Bought 2 pairs!

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes define comfort and wrap around your ankle for complete stability for those with narrow heels. I walk 3 miles 6 days per week and these are definitely the best walking shoe I ever had.
review.name: Best Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think these shoes have real potential for the right person. The right shoe was a little loose in the heel for me and they were a little too hard to put on and take off for my needs. But, I did really like them, they were just not quite right for me.
review.name: Not right for me, but could be good for you

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wide toe box, good fit with hiking-running socks, built in gator. Good multi use shoe that's light enough for trail running and supportive enough for longer hikes
review.name: Good buy!

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with these. They are great sneakers. Comfy and waterproof!
review.name: Fantastically waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.name: Great buy

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Alpha Outdry Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfy, warm, & incredible grip! Love these for out and about as well as hiking!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great design and size. . . . large wheels make it easy to pull and wide opening makes it easy to pack and find things when you have arrived. It should work well for many years. . . . just like all the other Osprey products that I have owned.
review.name: Great design and size. . . . large wheels

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been searching for the perfect duffel for a long time. This is it.
review.name: I have been searching for

review.reviewBody:
This met My Wife and My requirements for our next trip.
Easy to pull on wheels less likely to get knocked off.

Seems like the Biggest you can get for checking for airlines dimensionally in US.

Materials and construction should minimize damage suffered from Baggage Handling.  

We are getting the 40 Liter version next as a carry-on.
review.name: Great Check In Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the bag. It’s exactly what I needed. Durable but flexible enough to fully pack every inch. Super glad I purchased this bag.
review.name: Love the bag. It’s exactly

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I Love this Duffel. Great size, shape, and weight.
Love the heavy duty wheels! Love the heavy duty zippers!
This Transporter 90 has exceeded my expectations. I can’t wait to travel to Tibet with it later this year. MGB
review.name: I Love this Duffel. Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing travel bag , easy rollers. Got 4 bottles of wine spelt all over it on plane from someone else's terribly packed bag. Smell of wine gone after 4 days
review.name: Amazing travel bag , easy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Over the last ten years we have traveled extensively with the 120L, 90L and 30L. All are extremely sturdy, rolls well especially under load and very roomy. The exterior does get a little scratched and marred but no signs of tears or zipper wear. They are a little pricey but well worth the long term investment.
review.name: Over the last ten years

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this Osprey rolling bag. I travel frequently to villages in rural Alaska and it stores all my gear and is easy to manuever. It is totally weatherproof too. I won’t leave home without it!
review.name: I love this Osprey rolling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice sized and easy to roll duffel. We used it for the first time recently on a trip from Illinois to California; when we retrieved it from baggage claim, we noted that the waterproof finish was scratched through in one place, so I'm wondering if this will continue to happen as we have further travel with this bag.
review.name: This is a nice sized

review.reviewBody: I have had this bag for about 18 months - use it primarily for business travel. I LOVE it. Super durable, roomy, easy to move around with. I was looking at the listing today and noticed that the Osprey website says the flaps protect from rain. I have had the contents of my bag get wet a couple of times when I travelled during rain. Seems sitting on a luggage cart waiting to be loaded in the rain is when this happens. Just to be clear, would not prevent me from purchasing another one (not that I will need to due to the almighty guarantee!). However, it seems the rain protection is not great.
review.name: Love This Bag! (one thing could improve it)

name: Transporter Wheeled 90L Duffel
